result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Hoverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 2:55 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Mark A. Hoverson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes repeater enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 4 years, with conditions:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment, AODA & Mental Health treatment; to commence 10/10/14 by 7:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or any illegal drug
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--Random urinalyses
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $700 restitution, payable to Yangers Pub ($350 BOND TO BE APPLIED-remainder to be paid on Probation)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--No presence at Yanger's Pub
--No contact with Jeremy Snell, Landon Buckholdt or Lisa Weihert
--Letter of apology to victim, per Agent (within the 1st 60 days of probation)

Days credit for time already served: 6 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and denies expungement
Defendant to report to probation by EOB 9/12/14
Recess: 3:23 pm
Status conference on September 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 3:16 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Mark A. Hoverson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Requests additional STC, in 8 weeks. Mr. Hoverson now has funds to pay for AODA Assessment, which he will be making today. He has been told that the assessment will be scheduled in 4-6 weeks. Assessment will go far in maybe accomplishing settlement or at least informative to Court
ADA Shock: Requests matter be set for trial, have not been any bond issues
Court reminds Mr. Hoverson that his bond/conditions of bond remain in effect

[Reserve Judge Daniel Klossner presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Mark A. Hoverson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called at 1:23 pm
Defendant Mark A. Hoverson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviews conflict review worksheet and 3 prior cases where in the Court's former compacity was the supervisor of ADA Teuber who prosecuted those cases. Court concludes no conflict is found and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Court has reviewed the probable cause statement and finds that it states probable cause.
Attorney Svehlek provides updated address for the defendant.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $350.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No direct or indirect contact with Jeremy Snell, Landon Buckholt or Lisa Weihert
-No presence at Yangers Pub
-Defendant must appear at the Pretrial Conference on 2/26/14, Defendant must check in at the District Attorneys Office
-Defendant must appear at the Status Conference on 3/14/14 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:36 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 2/26/14 at 10:00 am
Status: 3/14/14 at 9:30 am
